item.title: Course Overview
item.description: IDS 2095 - The Future of Rain Forests - Fall 2021 Tropical Rain Forests cover approximately 15% of the Earth’s land surface but contain over 50% of the world’s biodiversity. They are also the home to millions of people, the source of products central to our lives, shape global climate, and are being cleared at unprecedented rates. In this class we will investigate the same fundamental questions asked by scientists that study rain forests:

item.title: GenEd Info
item.description: General Educations Designations for IDS 2935 (Rain Forests) Primary GenEd Designation: Biological Sciences Secondary GenEd Designation (if seeking): International (N) A minimum grade of C is required for general education Writing designation: No writing designation

item.title: Course Meetings, Location, & Weekly Schedule
item.description: Meeting Day, Time, & Location: Tuesday Period 4 (10:40 AM - 11:30 AM) in AND101 AND Thursday Period 4-5 (10:40 AM - 12:35 PM) in WM 0202 WHY ARE WE FASCINATED BY TROPICAL RAIN FORESTS? Week 1 24-Aug Introduction to each other and the course. What is a ‘tropical rain forest’? 26-Aug Where do stereotypes about rain forests come from?

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: pages
item.description: TEST Tropical Rain Forests cover approximately 15% of the Earth’s land surface but contain over 50% of the world’s biodiversity. They are also the home to millions of people, the source of products central to our lives, shape global climate, and are being cleared at unprecedented rates. In this class we will investigate the same fundamental questions asked by scientists that study rain forests: Why are we fascinated by rain forests?
